features: Classic pull-along toy musical instrument for toddlers
Toddlers can use the tethered mallet to tap on the 8 colorful keys for fun sounds
Pull string and easy-rolling wheels let toddlers pull it along anywhere
Helps develop hand-eye coordination and gross motor skills
For toddlers and kids ages 18 months and older
body.description: The Fisher-Price Classic Xylophone pull toy has 8 colorful keys to encourage early music-making creativity, helping toddlers develop a sense of accomplishment. And as their musical abilities grow, mini maestros can follow the colors to create a real song! The mallet’s attached so it never gets lost. And it’s on wheels so toddlers can walk and pull their musical instrument wherever they go!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Tap into early music-making fun Baby can start off by just tapping the keys with the attached mallet or pulling the Fisher-Price Classic Xylophone along (it’s on wheels!). As your baby grows, your mini Mozart can follow the colors to play a real song. Get developing skills rolling By holding the string and pulling the xylophone along, little walkers will strengthen gross motor skills as well as their balance and coordination. Grasping the mallet and tapping the keys help tune up hand-eye coordination and fine motor skills. Classic, baby-favorite musical pull toy For infants and toddlers ages 18 months and older

Rock this parenting thing At Fisher-Price, we live to help parents feel more ready. From baby gear that makes new-parent life easier to fun toys that help entertain and teach your kids as they grow, we’ve been helping parents feel more confident about raising tiny humans for generations.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Classic xylophone for toddlers and preschoolers
reviews.reviewText: My kids had similar xylophones when they were little and I wanted to get a couple of these for expected babies in the family for when they are a little older, while these are available from Fisher-Price and at a good price. The xylophone has an octave of real musical notes and kids can learn to play actual tunes as they get older, or they can just enjoy the colors, pulling the toy, and playing random notes when they are younger, and count the bars a little later. The plastic stick/mallet is attached will a short cord so it is safe. it appears sturdy as most Fisher-Price toys areThis is a toddler toy that remains useful as the child grows, and almost all kids like to play with a xylophone. This one isn't too loud. I haven't opened the packaging completely so I don't know if a simple set of tunes is included or not, but hopefully it is as in the past. The product info does not mention one, though, so maybe not.One tune I still recall from decades ago goes (numbered from lowest to highest notes): 1-2-3-1, 1-2-3-1, 3-4-5, 3-4-5. 5-6-5-4-3-1, 5-6-5-4-3-1, 8-5-8, 8-5-8. LOL. You'll recognize it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best baby toy of all time
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This is one of the most traditional toys that still entertain babies and toddlers in 2021. It’s also very inexpensive and doesn’t require batteries. My grandson is a year old and his face lights up every time he bangs on this. The string that attaches the stick is a catch 22. It’s great because you don’t have to worry about losing the stick. However, it’s a little short and makes some of the notes hard to play. But I get if it were too much longer it could possibly be a choking hazard and it could rap around a babies neck. Also, he bangs on this with anything (and I mean anything) he can find and it works so you don’t necessarily have to use the stick. It also has wheels on it so sometimes he just slides it across the room. I would absolutely recommend everyone getting their baby one of these. It’s fun and educational, super inexpensive, and very practical. This is honestly one of his favorite toys and he has so many that do so much more Lighting up in craziness. But there is something to be said about the simplicity of this toy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive, durable toy
reviews.reviewText: Very happy with this purchase, my 1.5 year old loves banging on it. It seems to be quite durable and it is the perfect size.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great toy for kids of all ages! I do wish the cord was slightly longer but I’m sure it’s a safety thing. I also think it’s a bit odd to have two red colors at the end but my child doesn’t seem to care at all. Works great, sounds good!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great xylophone - short string
reviews.reviewText: My kiddo loves this xylophone. The notes are tuned and ring nicely. My only gripe is the string used to attach the mallet was a little short, so it was difficult even for me to play all the notes. I ended up opening the xylophone base and replacing the string. Otherwise it is very sturdy and will hold up with play for years to come.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely a winner!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this toy for my two-year-old grandson. He absolutely loves it, and considering how he pounds on it I can say it is very durable. The sound quality is exactly what you would expect from a xylophone. Another good aspect of this is that he can pull it as he goes room to room. Highly recommend! Hours of fun!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fisher price quality!
reviews.reviewText: Had a wooden pull along xylophone when I was little and it has survived 50+years. I wanted to get my new grandson one and saw many different kinds. I opted on sticking with fisher price and I am glad I did. Maybe a little different materials but still designed with longevity in mind. Great quality. I hope my boy loves his and still has it 50 years from now

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My one year old granddaughter loves it! And the rounded corners and attached mallet are perfect for little ones!
Estamos encantados com esse xilofone, uma fofura. O único defeito é a corda que é muito curta. De resto, meu filho amou. Muito divertido! :)
Es un juguete muy entretenido y llegó a tiempo. Excelente calidad. Pero si es un poco pesado.
I would highly recommend this toy. It’s fun to use doesn’t need batteries isn’t fragile or breakable. It’s just a good all-around toy for my grandson.

Très jolie jouet. Les roues fonctionnent très bien, le son est très bon, le jouet est de très bonne qualité; il fait voiture et xylophone, que demander de plus... si je sais que bébé arrête de nous casser les tympans.
Jättefin leksak pinnen fastknyten så man kan använda den för att dra leksaken efter sig.Utvecklande då den inte är elektronisk utan man får slå som på en riktig xylofon
